item.description:
Can this be inspected please?

item.title: Can this pothole be inspected and marked up please?, 6th November
item.description:
Can this pothole be inspected please and hopefully filled in asap by Riney, the Council's current contractor.

item.title: The lights in Highland Road are in the trees. The branches of the tree outside 109 Highland Road is very low and an accident waiting to happen, 6th November
item.description:
Highland Road is quite dark to walk along at night. The some of the branches of the tree outside 109 Highland Road (I think) are dangerously low.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Madeira Avenue, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All lights out on Marlborough Road, 6th November
item.description:
The photo probably doesn't show just how dangerously dark it is on Marlborough Road with ALL the street lights out of order. This is especially dangerous for cyclists and other vulnerable road users.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pall Mall, Victoria, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More flytipping, 6th November
item.description:
Again more household furniture has been flytipped here. It happens every day, please investigate this issue
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Mission Place, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Opposite no. 16, 6th November
item.description:
The street light, column number 9, has not been working for some time. As light no 8, opposite house no. 20 is not working either, a long stretch of the road there remains unlit, creating a safety risk for pedestrians and residents. Please repair these two lights asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 39,41,43,45,47,49, Lyndhurst Gardens, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Opposite no. 20 Lyndhurst Gardens (outside Marie Curie Hospice), 6th November
item.description:
The street light, column number 8, is not working. As light no 9, opposite house no. 16 at Lyndhurst Gardens, is not working either, a long stretch remains unlit, creating a safety risk for pedestrians and residents. Please repair these two lights asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lyndhurst Gardens, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping by bin near cinnar, 5th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 404, Footscray Road, New Eltham, London

item.title: Lamp post light is flickering brightly., 5th November
item.description:
The lamp has been flashing non stop for a month now. I thought it was an emergency service or road works but it's just looks like a dodgy light bulb. The whole street corner flashes at night. It must be a hazard for drivers too who could be falsely alarmed by the flashing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beckenham Lane, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28-52, Pilgrimage Street, The Borough, London

item.title: Litter on the planter and pavement on Tabard Street, 5th November
item.description:
There are food packaging, rubbish bags and paper on the on planters and pavement on Tabard Street specifically around the brown planters. This has not been cleared up despite Fixmystreet stating it was removed. It has been there for seven days.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tabard Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No street lighting in the park, 5th November
item.description:
Once the sun goes down, the paths are so dark that you can’t see where you’re walking. I had to walk with my phone torch on. It really doesn’t feel safe, and it feels like it’d be easy to trip up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Carriage Drive, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet
